awd_titl_txt: Augmented Hydrostatic Extrusion for Ultrafine Bonding Wire
awd_abstract_narration: The project concerns an augmented hydrostatic extrusion                    process for the production of fine wire, less than one mil in                   diameter, needed for the bonding of microchips.  Results from                   earlier work led to a detailed understanding of the factors                     limiting the productivity of this process and a prototype                       laboratory unit has verified the effectiveness of appropriate                   control procedures in overcoming these limitations.                                  An integrated system for clean room operation will be                      designed.  The prototype will demonstrate both the economic                     advantages of the augmented hydrostatic extrusion process and the               reliability and quality of the wire produced.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
